strategy: After robust scaling, apply a log transformation to the scaled Age and Fare features to further stabilize variance and reduce skewness, which can improve the performance of tree-based models that are sensitive to feature distributions.

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import RobustScaler
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X_train = train_df[['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values safely
X_train['Age'] = X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median())
X_train['Fare'] = X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median())
X_train['Embarked'] = X_train['Embarked'].fillna(X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0])

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Apply robust scaling to Age and Fare
scaler = RobustScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train[['Age', 'Fare']])
X_train[['Age', 'Fare']] = X_train_scaled

# Apply log transformation to scaled Age and Fare
X_train['Age'] = np.log1p(X_train['Age'])
X_train['Fare'] = np.log1p(X_train['Fare'])

# Prepare test data
X_test = test_df[['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']]
X_test['Age'] = X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median())
X_test['Fare'] = X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median())
X_test['Embarked'] = X_test['Embarked'].fillna(X_test['Embarked'].mode()[0])

X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test[['Age', 'Fare']])
X_test[['Age', 'Fare']] = X_test_scaled

# Apply log transformation to scaled Age and Fare
X_test['Age'] = np.log1p(X_test['Age'])
X_test['Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Passeng

X_test['Age'] = X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median())
X_test['Fare'] = X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median())
X_test['Embarked'] = X_test['Embarked'].fillna(X_test['Embarked'].mode()[0])

X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test[['Age', 'Fare']])
X_test[['Age', 'Fare']] = X_test_scaled

# Apply log transformation to scaled Age and Fare (only if values are non-negative)
X_test['Age'] = np.log1p(X_test['Age'])
X_test['Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])

# Ensure no infinite or invalid values after log transformation

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import RobustScaler
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target

y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values safely
X_train['Age'] = X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median())
X_train['Fare'] = X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median())
X_train['Embarked'] = X_train['Embarked'].fillna(X_train['Embarked'].mode()[0])

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Apply robust scaling to Age and Fare
scaler = RobustScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train[['Age', 'Fare']])
X_train[['Age', 'Fare']] = X_train_scaled

# Apply log transformation to scaled Age and Fare (only if values are non-negative)
X_train['Age'] = np.log1p(X_train['Age'])
X_train['Fare'] = np.log1p(X_train['Fare'])

# Prepare test data

X_test['Fare'] = X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median())
X_test['Embarked'] = X_test['Embarked'].fillna(X_test['Embarked'].mode()[0])

X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test[['Age', 'Fare']])
X_test[['Age', 'Fare']] = X_test_scaled

# Apply log transformation to scaled Age and Fare (only if values are non-negative)
X_test['Age'] = np.log1p(X_test['Age'])
X_test['Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])

# Ensure no infinite or invalid values after log transformation
